page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: The main settlements of this block are the two villages of Thurgoland and Wortley and the two hamlets of Crane Moor and Green Moor.The main geographical feature is the valley of the River Don to the south.Northwards the land begins to slope down to the lower area around Barnsley.Most of the area is Green Belt land.The gentler slopes are used mainly for dairy farming,with some cereals and potatoes.Steeper gradients are mixed woodland and rough pasture.New housing estates have recently been built in the block but many people travel to work in Stocksbridge,Barnsley and Sheffield.
